intro: Othonnopsis clutiifolia, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Othonnopsis clutiifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
